title._content: [Byron Chandler's ''The Plantation'' estate, Palm Beach, FL]

description._content: Title: [Byron Chandler's ''The Plantation'' estate, Palm Beach, FL] Creator: Robert Yarnall Richie Date: ca. 1932-1934 Part Of: Robert Yarnall Richie Photograph Collection Place: Palm Beach, Palm Beach County, Florida Description: This photograph depicts the Plantation, an estate located on Wells Road at Lake Worth in Palm Beach, Florida, and owned at that time by Byron D. Chandler and his fourth wife, the former Gene (Betty) West. Built around 1933, the Plantation marked the architectural change of Palm Beach estates from the Mediterranean-style designs of Addison Mizner to smaller, West Indies-style homes. Sources: End of Playboy Chandler's $2,000,000 Spree, Milwaukee Sentinel, January 31, 1943, United States Online Historical Newspapers. Whiteheads Purchase Palm Beach Residence, Palm Beach Post, February 3, 1943, United States Online Historical Newspapers. Physical Description: 1 negative: film, black and white; 13.6 x 17.8 cm File: ag1982_0234_0166_02_chandler_sm_opt.jpg Rights: Please cite Southern Methodist University, Central University Libraries, DeGolyer Library when using this image file. A high-quality version of this file may be obtained for a fee by contacting degolyer@smu.edu. For more information and to view the image in high resolution, see: digitalcollections.smu.edu/cdm/ref/collection/ryr/id/1827 View the Robert Yarnall Richie photograph collection: digitalcollections.smu.edu/all/cul/ryr/
